paragraph: Daniel Moore (born 1941 in Walla Walla, Washington, U.S.) is an American musician, singer and songwriter.

He co-wrote the song "My Maria" with B. W. Stevenson.  Recorded by the latter, the song was a pop hit in 1973.  Moore also wrote the song "Shambala", a song which was a hit for both B. W. Stevenson and Three Dog Night that same year. "My Maria" was also a country hit in 1996 when recorded by Brooks and Dunn. In addition, Moore has written songs for other artists, including Joe Cocker and Bonnie Raitt. In late 1975, he contributed backing vocals for the tracks on Bo Diddley's The 20th Anniversary of Rock 'n' Roll all-star album.
Moore currently runs his own record label, DJM Records.
As a song writer, Daniel Moore has had songs recorded by:
The Hughes Corporation, "One More River to Cross" 1971
James and Bobby Purify, "Lay Me Down Easy" 1974
Bonnie Bramlet, "How Do I Love You" 1975
Jennifer Warnes,  "Bring Olâ€™ Maggie Back  Home"   1976
John Hartford & The Dillards, "Join the Old Refrain" 1976
David Clayton Thomas, "Somebody I Trusted" (Put Out The Light) 1976
Canned Heat, "One More River to Cross" 1977
Kim Carnes, "Take Me Home to Where My Heart Is" 1984
Marsha Ball, "So Many Rivers to Cross" 2006
Riding a Horse & Holding up the World - 1998
